choices.text: Esophageal branches of the left gastric vessels

questions.text: All of the following structures pass through the esophageal hiatus except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Thoracic duct

Exp: Thoracic duct passes through aortic opening

questions.text: A 29 year-old man comes in with a stab wound, cannot raise his arm above horizontal, and exhibits a condition known as winged scapula while pushing against the wall. Which of the following structures of the brachial plexus would most likely be damaged?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

 Roots
Exp: winged scapula while pushing against the wall means patient has S. Anterior muscle paralyzed because of Long Thoracic nerve involvement which arises from roots.

questions.text: The middle radioulnar joint is a :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Syndesmosis
Ref:Read the text below 
Sol: 
FIBROUS JOINTS
Are joined by fibrous tissue.
Are of three types -
a) SYNDESMOSIS - the bones are connected by interosseous ligament. - eg. inferior tibiofibular joint, Intervertebral joints
b) SUTURES :Peculiar to skull & are immovable
c) GOMPHOSIS :is a peg & socket joint , eg. Tooth & socket joint

questions.text: A football player experiences an anterior dislocation of the shoulder. Cutaneous sensation over the lower half of the deltoid muscle is impaired. These findings suggest damage to which of the following nerves?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Axillary 
Ref: Read the text below 
Sol:
The axillary nerve can be damaged during anterior dislocation of the shoulder, causing loss of sensation in the skin overlying the lower half of the deltoid muscle.

choices.text: Anterior intercostal arteries for intercostals spaces 7–9
Posterior intercostals arteries for intercostals spaces 3–11

questions.text: The musculophrenic arteries give rise to ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Anterior intercostal arteries for intercostals spaces 7–9
Reference – Read the text below
Sol:   
•    The musculophrenic artery gives rise to anterior intercostal arteries for intercostal spaces 7–9.

questions.text: The clavipectoral fascia is pierced by which of the following structures?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Lateral pectoral nerve 

Ref.:Read the text below
Sol :
Structures Piercing Clavipectoral Fascia :
    Lateral pectoral nerve 
    Cephalic vein 
    Thoracoacromial vessels 
    Lymphatics passing from breast & pectoral region to the apical group of axillary lymph nodes.

questions.text: Anterior belly of  digastric  is a  derivate of  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

1st branchial  arch  
Ref: Read the text below
Sol 
Anterior belly of  digastric   is derived from first arch
Posterior belly of  digastric   is derived from Second arch

questions.text: Epithelial   lining   of  esophagus  is   :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Stratified   squamous  non-  keratinized   
Ref: Read the text below
Sol
 esophagus is lined by Stratified   squamous  non-  keratinized

questions.text: Which  part   of  the ear  has   origin   from  all the  three  layer  of  germ  layer  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Tympanic  membrane
Ref: Read the text below
Sol Tympanic  membrane has   origin   from  all the  three  layer  of  germ  layer

questions.text: The Left superior intercostal vein drains into :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Left brachiocephalic vein    
Ref– Read the text below
Sol:
•    The  1st  left posterior intercostal vein drains into the left brachiocephalic vein.
•    The 2nd , 3rd , & 4th left posterior intercostal veins  join to form the left superior intercostals vein that drains into the left brachiocephalic vein.
•    The 5th , 6th, 7th& 8th  join to form the accessory hemiazygous vein which drain in the azygous vein
•    The 9th, 10th , 11th& 12th join to form the hemiazygous vein which also drain into the  azygous vein.

questions.text: False regarding Erb’s paralysis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Difficulty in abduction
Ref: Read the text below
Sol : Adducted and medial rotated arm, flexed and pronated forearm is seen in Erb’s paralysis

questions.text: Tensor Tympani issupplied by
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Trigeminal 

Ref: Langman's Medical Embryology 10thed pg 258

questions.text: Whichn of the following muscle is supplied by a branch of Posterior cord of brachial plexus :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Teres minor
Ref: Read the text below
Sol :  Posterior cord gives five branches, including axillary nerve which supplies teres minor muscle.

questions.text: Spinal part of accessory nerve supplies :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Sternocleidomastoid
Exp: Spinal Accessory nerve supplies SCM & Trapezius

questions.text: Soft palate muscles are  supplied by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

VAC
• Most of the palate muscles are supplied by the vagus accessory complex ( pharyngeal plexus), except tensor palati (which is supplied by the mandibular nerve, trigeminal).

questions.text: Which nerve supplies the marked area
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Radial nerve

questions.text: Clavipectoral fascia splits to enclose subclavius and pectoralis minor, and continues as:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Suspensory ligament

Ref: Read the text below
Sol : 
•    Below pectoralis minor muscle, clavipetoral fascia extends downwards as the suspensory ligament of axilla, which attach and pulls up the dome of the axillary fascia (and maintain the concavity of the axilla).

questions.text: Foot drop occurs as a result of injury to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Deep peroneal nerve 
Ref: Read the text below
Sol : 
•    The common peroneal nerve divides into superficial peroneal  ( lateral compartment) & a deep peroneal ( anterior compartment)
•    The muscles of the anterior compartment cause dorsiflexion at the ankle joint. 
•    Paralysis thus results in foot drop. 
•    The gait in cases of foot drop is High Stepping Gait.

questions.text: Artery beneath red mark in the image below.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Middle meningeal
•    The pterion is the region where the frontal, parietal, temporal, and sphenoid bone join together.
•    Anterior division of middle meningeal artery overlies it
•    It is located on the side of the skull, just behind the temple.

questions.text: Brachialis is supplied by -
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Radial and musculocutaneous nerve
Ref: Read the text below
Sol 
Brachialis is supplied by Radial and musculocutaneous nerve

questions.text: Killian dehiscence is in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Inferior constrictor
• Inferior constrictor muscle has two parts: Upper thyropharyngeus made up of oblique fibres and lower cricopharyngeus made up of transverse fibres.
• There is a potential gap posteriorly between the two parts called as pharyngeal dimple or Killian’s dehiscence.

questions.text: Cells which surround the oocyte in Graffian follicle are called?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

cumulus Oophorus
Exp: Cells which surround the oocyte in Graffian follicle are called cumulus Oophorus and site of attachment is called Discus Proligerus.

questions.text: Epiploic Foramen is bounded by all except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Free border of Greater omentum

questions.text: Morphologically, Anconeus is considered to be a detached portion of :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Medial head of triceps
Ref.: Read the text below
Sol :  
Anconeus 
Origin 
    Posterior aspect of the lateral epicondyle of humerus 
Morphology 
    It is thought to be a detached portion of the medial head of triceps 
    Functionally it is related to medial head of triceps 
Insertion 
Lateral aspect of olecranon process

choices.text: Dorsal motor nucleus of the vagus

questions.text: The nucleus that gives rise to motor fibers that innervate muscles of larynx, pharynx, and palate is the:-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Nucleus ambiguus
Ref: Read the text below
Sol : 
•    The nucleus ambiguus gives rise to the motor innervation of larynx, pharynx, and palate. The hypoglossal nucleus innervates the tongue muscle.

questions.text: Froment  test  is  positive  in  lesion  of  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Ulnar   nerve  

Ref: Read the text below
Sol It is seen in paralysis of Adductor policis supplied by ulnar nerve

choices.text: Meiosis   occurs  only  after   secondary spermatocyte   stage

questions.text: Which of the following  is a  true  statement  regarding  spermatogenesis   :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Takes  around  74 days 
 Ref: Read the text below
Sol 
•    Spermatogenesis takes around  74 days   
•    Capacitation takes around 7 hours

questions.text: Flexion of MCP joint and extension of IP joints is the major action of All except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

FDS

Ref: Read the text below
Sol Flexion of MCP joint and extension of IP joints is the major action of Lumbricals & interossei .
FDS flexes the Proximal interphalangeal joint

choices.text: It is separated from adjacent segments by connective tissue septa.
It is the largest subdivision of a lobe.
It is named according to the segmental bronchus supplying it.

questions.text: All of the following statements correctly apply to a bronchopulmonary segment except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

It is not resectable.
Reference – Read the text below
Sol:   
•    A bronchopulmonary segment is a pyramid shaped segment of the lung with its apex facing the lung root and its base at the pleural surface.
•    It is the largest subdivision of a lobe and is separated from adjacent segments by connective tissue.
It is surgically resectable

questions.text: Left  ovarian  vein  drain  into  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Left   renal  vein
Ref: Read the text below
Sol 
Left  ovarian  vein  drains  into  Left renal vein 
right ovarian  vein  drains to IVC

choices.text: Chorda tympani in the middle ear cavity

questions.text: A 46-year-old man complains of dryness of the mouth. On examination he  lack salivary secretion from the submandibular gland. This indicates a lesion of which of the following nervous structures?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Chorda tympani in the middle ear cavity
Ref: Read the text below
Sol Because Chorda tympani in the middle ear cavity carries the salivatory fibers to Submandibular gland

questions.text: Capacitation takes place  mainly in :-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Fallopian tube
Ref: Read the text below
Sol : Fallopian tube contributes most among female genital tract Although all parts as given in options are involved in this process

questions.text: A young patient with absent thymus and  presented with hypoparathyroidism and tetany.  Which of the following marked area  in the picture is defective in this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Ref: Read the text below
Sol : 
Given condition is Digeorge syndrome. 
“A” is the marked area for third pharyngeal pouch from where thymus and inf. Parathyroid develop

questions.text: Arterial supply   of  caecum   is  through  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Ileocolic   artery  
Ref: Read the text below
Sol Ileocolic   artery  supplies terminal part of ileum , part of Ascending colon,Caecum and appendix

questions.text: A middle-aged women complained that her right-hand tremors when she attempts to insert a thread in the eye of sewing needle; and her body sways towards the right side while walking. On physical examination the Physician found that: there is flaccidity of limb muscles on the right side, and when she was asked to touch the tip of her nose with her right index finger, the finger tended to overshoot the target. Which part of the Brain is affected?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cerebellum

Ref: Read the text below
Sol All the given features indicate Cerebellar syndrome

questions.text: A patient recovering from a traumatic injury to the face now finds himself unable to chew his food. On physical examination, his jaw deviates to the right side. The nerve that has been injured in this patient exits the skull through which of the following foramina?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Foramen ovale
Ref: Read the text below
Sol All the given features indicate that Mandibular nerve is involved
 hence Foramen ovale is correct

questions.text: Which  of the following artery  is  present  in  anatomical  snuff  box   :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Radial  artery   
Ref: Snell’s   Clinical  Anatomy,   7th  ed .,  p-533

choices.text: Gluteus  Maximus,  Gluteus   Medius  and   Gluteus  Minimus

questions.text: Positive Trendelenburg  sign    indicates      of  which   group   of   gluteus    muscles    :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Gluterus Medius and  Gluteus Minimus
Ref: Read the text below
Sol This is done to check the integrity of Gluterus Medius and  Gluteus Minimus and their nerve supply  ie superior gluteal nerve.

questions.text: Horse   shoe   kidney  lies   below   the  level  of   :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Inferior   mesenteric  artery
Ref: Read the text below
Sol It lies at the level of Inferior   mesenteric  artery because its ascent is blocked by this artery only

questions.text: Schwann cell is derivative of?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Neural crest cells

Ref: Read the text below
Sol . Schwann cell is derivative of Neural crest cells
